summary.S: Hello, I'm Ahmed Mohammed, DevOps Engineer with 3+ years of hands-on experience in automating, optimizing, and maintaining mission-critical deployments in cloud-based environments, including expertise in infrastructure as code (IaC), CI/CD pipelines, containerization, monitoring, and AWS. Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline development, enhance system reliability, and accelerate software delivery cycles.

L.S: Led the successful completion of a 3-year cloud migration project, transitioning enterprise infrastructure from an on-premises data center to AWS, resulting in improved system performance, cost efficiency, and scalability
Refactored legacy Chef cookbooks to ensure compatibility and optimal performance with newly migrated AWS-based servers, improving configuration reliability and deployment efficiency

Successfully migrated 400+ on-premise microservices, applications, and Linux environments to AWS, leveraging automation tools and IaC (Terraform & Chef) to reduce deployment time by 40%, improving system scalability and reliability
Developed and maintained CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins ensuring seamless application deployments while achieving zero customer-facing downtime
Delivered 24/7 on-call support for critical Linux-based infrastructure, ensuring rapid response and resolution of major incidents to maintain system uptime and reliability

description.S: Deployed a scalable microservices-based application using Python, AWS EKS, Docker, and Helm, enabling video-to-audio conversion. Leveraged RabbitMQ for asynchronous processing and utilized MongoDB and PostgreSQL for efficient and scalable storage of video data
